summary: Hermione is among the first students to be sorted, and she shows clear signs of stress—standing stiffly and looking very nervous. Despite her previous bravado on the train, her tension in this moment underscores how much the sorting matters to her. Her posture and expression suggest a fear of not measuring up, even before stepping forward. This moment reinforces her need for external validation and her intense internal pressure to succeed.
logline: Hermione’s outward poise gives way to visible anxiety as the Sorting Hat moment approaches.
speech_style: Not verbal in this scene; emotional state is visible through body language and tension
